info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 26 at 10:13PM EST until December 27 at 8:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by runoff from recent excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Burke County in western North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 115 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1008 PM EST, Stream gauges indicate continued minor flooding along the Johns River north of Morganton. Radar shows additional light rain showers moving over the area from the south. This additional rainfall will slow the fall in river and stream stages and minor flooding in northern Burke County should continue into the early morning hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of North Central Burke County - Flooding is most likely along the Johns River north of Morganton, especially along and near Corpening Road, Playmore Beach Road, and Johns River Road. Flooding will extend north to the Caldwell County border near the confluence with Wilson Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
